skill.name: marimo-development
skill.description: Expert guidance for creating and working with marimo notebooks - reactive Python notebooks that can be executed as scripts and deployed as apps. Use when the user asks to create marimo notebooks, convert Jupyter notebooks to marimo, build interactive dashboards or data apps with marimo, work with marimo's reactive programming model, debug marimo notebooks, or needs help with marimo-specific features (cells, UI elements, reactivity, SQL integration, deploying apps, etc.).

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown reference files. No executable code, scripts, network operations, or filesystem access capabilities. All 1405 static findings are false positives triggered by documentation content patterns.

content.user_title: Create reactive Python notebooks with marimo
content.value_statement: Marimo is a reactive Python notebook environment that guarantees consistent state between code and outputs. This skill provides expert guidance for building interactive data apps and reproducible notebooks that run as scripts and deploy as web apps.
actual_capabilities: Create marimo notebooks with reactive cell execution
Build interactive UIs with sliders, dropdowns, tables, and forms
Work with SQL and DuckDB for data queries
Deploy notebooks as interactive web apps
Debug common marimo issues and reactivity problems
Convert Jupyter notebooks to marimo format
limitations: Does not execute code directly - provides guidance only
Cannot install marimo or Python packages
Cannot access local files or databases
Focused on marimo, not general Python development

use_cases.title: Build reactive data notebooks
use_cases.description: Create reproducible data analysis workflows with automatic cell execution and interactive exploration.

use_cases.title: Convert Jupyter notebooks
use_cases.description: Transform existing Jupyter notebooks into marimo format for better reproducibility and version control.

use_cases.title: Create data web apps
use_cases.description: Deploy notebooks as interactive web apps with sliders, forms, and real-time data visualization.

prompt_templates.title: Create simple notebook
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a basic marimo notebook that displays a slider and shows the squared value when the slider changes.

prompt_templates.title: Build data dashboard
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a marimo notebook that loads a CSV file, displays it in a table, and includes a dropdown filter.

prompt_templates.title: SQL data analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a marimo notebook that uses DuckDB SQL to query a dataframe with parameterized queries.

prompt_templates.title: Deploy web app
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to convert a marimo notebook into a deployable web app with CLI arguments.

output_examples.input: Create a marimo notebook with a slider that controls the number of data points and displays a scatter plot.
output: Cell 1: Import marimo, polars, altair, and numpy
Cell 2: Create a slider UI element with range 10-500
Cell 3: Generate random data points based on slider value
Cell 4: Create and display an Altair scatter plot
The notebook automatically re-runs when the slider changes

best_practices: Always import marimo as mo in the first cell and keep imports grouped together
Use local variables prefixed with underscore for values that should not be shared between cells
Run marimo check --fix after creating a notebook to catch common issues automatically
anti_patterns: Never redeclare variables across cells - this violates marimo's reactivity model
Do not use global keyword - it breaks the notebook execution model
Avoid circular dependencies in cells - reorganize code to remove cycles

faq.question: What is marimo?
faq.answer: Marimo is a reactive Python notebook environment where cells automatically re-run when their dependencies change.

faq.question: How does marimo differ from Jupyter?
faq.answer: Marimo guarantees reproducible notebooks, stores notebooks as pure Python files, and has built-in reactive UI elements.

faq.question: Can I deploy marimo notebooks as web apps?
faq.answer: Yes, any marimo notebook can be deployed as an interactive web app using the marimo run command.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using marimo?
faq.answer: Marimo notebooks run locally. The skill provides guidance only and cannot access your data without explicit instructions.

faq.question: What UI elements does marimo support?
faq.answer: Marimo includes sliders, dropdowns, buttons, tables, dataframes, forms, tabs, text inputs, and more.

faq.question: Can I use SQL with marimo?
faq.answer: Yes, marimo has built-in DuckDB support with mo.sql() for running SQL queries directly against dataframes.
